content:
ReplicationConnection Class

Definition

The ReplicationConnection class represents a replication connection.

In this Article

public class ReplicationConnection : IDisposable
Inheritance
System.Object
ReplicationConnection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

In Active Directory Domain Services, a replication connection is represented by an NTDS-Connection object. For more information, see the "NTDS-Connection" topic in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Constructors

ReplicationConnection(DirectoryContext,String,DirectoryServer)

Initializes a new instance of the ReplicationConnection class, using the specified context, name, and source server.

public ReplicationConnection (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string name, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer sourceServer);
context
DirectoryContext

A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials with which to establish a replication connection.

name
String

The user-defined name of the connection.

sourceServer
DirectoryServer

A DirectoryServer object that identifies the source server of the connection.

Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ArgumentException

This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

  • The target of the context parameter is not a domain controller or AD LDS instance.

  • sourceServer is invalid or an empty string.

  • The target specified in the context parameter does not match the server type specified in the sourceServer parameter. The servers must both be either domain controllers or AD LDS instances.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are domain controllers, but are not in the same forest.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are AD LDS instances, but do not belong to the same configuration set.

ArgumentNullException

context or sourceServer is null.

AuthenticationException

The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

ReplicationConnection(DirectoryContext,String,DirectoryServer,ActiveDirectorySchedule)

Initializes a new instance of the ReplicationConnection class, using the specified context, name, source server, and schedule.

public ReplicationConnection (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string name, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer sourceServer, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule schedule);
context
DirectoryContext

A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials with which to establish a replication connection.

name
String

The user-defined name of the connection.

sourceServer
DirectoryServer

A DirectoryServer object that identifies the source server of the connection.

schedule
ActiveDirectorySchedule

A ActiveDirectorySchedule object that specifies when the source is available for replication.

Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ArgumentException

This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

  • The target of the context parameter is not a domain controller or AD LDS instance.

  • sourceServer is invalid or an empty string.

  • The target specified in the context parameter does not match the server type specified in the sourceServer parameter. The servers must both be either domain controllers or AD LDS instances.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are domain controllers, but are not in the same forest.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are AD LDS instances, but do not belong to the same configuration set.

ArgumentNullException

context, sourceServer or schedule is null.

AuthenticationException

The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

ReplicationConnection(DirectoryContext,String,DirectoryServer,ActiveDirectoryTransportType)

Initializes a new instance of the ReplicationConnection class, using the specified context, name, source server, and transport type.

public ReplicationConnection (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string name, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer sourceServer, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryTransportType transport);
context
DirectoryContext

A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to establish a replication connection with.

name
String

The user-defined name of the connection.

sourceServer
DirectoryServer

A DirectoryServer object that identifies the source server of the connection.

transport
ActiveDirectoryTransportType

One of the ActiveDirectoryTransportType members that specifies the transport type of the connection.

Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ArgumentException

This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

  • The target of the context parameter is not a domain controller or AD LDS instance.

  • sourceServer is invalid or an empty string.

  • The target specified in the context parameter does not match the server type specified in the sourceServer parameter. The servers must both be either domain controllers or AD LDS instances.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are domain controllers, but are not in the same forest.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are AD LDS instances, but do not belong to the same configuration set.

ArgumentNullException

context or sourceServer is null.

AuthenticationException

The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

InvalidEnumArgumentException

transport is not a valid ActiveDirectoryTransportType value.

NotSupportedException

context is an AD LDS instance and transport is ActiveDirectoryTransportType, which is not supported.

ReplicationConnection(DirectoryContext,String,DirectoryServer,ActiveDirectorySchedule,ActiveDirectoryTransportType)

Initializes a new instance of the ReplicationConnection class, using the specified context, name, source server, schedule, and transport type.

public ReplicationConnection (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string name, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer sourceServer, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule schedule, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryTransportType transport);
context
DirectoryContext

A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials with which to establish a replication connection.

name
String

The user-defined name of the connection.

sourceServer
DirectoryServer

A DirectoryServer object that identifies the source server of the connection.

schedule
ActiveDirectorySchedule

A ActiveDirectorySchedule object that specifies when the source is available for replication.

transport
ActiveDirectoryTransportType

One of the ActiveDirectoryTransportType members that specifies the transport type of the connection.

Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ArgumentException

This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

  • The target of the context parameter is not a domain controller or AD LDS instance.

  • sourceServer is invalid or an empty string.

  • The target specified in the context parameter does not match the server type specified in the sourceServer parameter. The servers must both be either domain controllers or AD LDS instances.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are domain controllers, but are not in the same forest.

  • The servers specified in the context and sourceServer parameters are AD LDS instances, but do not belong to the same configuration set.

ArgumentNullException

context, sourceServer or schedule is null.

AuthenticationException

The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

InvalidEnumArgumentException

transport is not valid.

NotSupportedException

context is an AD LDS instance and transport is ActiveDirectoryTransportType, which is not supported.

Properties

ChangeNotificationStatus

Gets or sets the change notification status of this replication connection.

public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.NotificationStatus ChangeNotificationStatus { get; set; }
Value
NotificationStatus

One of the NotificationStatus members that specifies the change notification status of this replication connection.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

When setting the property, the new value is not valid.

ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

DataCompressionEnabled

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this replication connection compresses data.

public bool DataCompressionEnabled { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if this replication connection uses data compression; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

DestinationServer

Gets the DNS name of the server that is the destination of this replication connection.

public string DestinationServer { get; }
Value
String

A string that contains the DNS name of the server that is the destination of this replication connection.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

Enabled

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this replication connection is enabled.

public bool Enabled { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if this replication connection is enabled; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

GeneratedByKcc

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this replication connection was generated by the knowledge consistency checker (KCC).

public bool GeneratedByKcc { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if this replication connection was generated by the KCC; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

Name

Gets the name of this replication connection.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

A string that contains the user-defined name of this replication connection.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

ReciprocalReplicationEnabled

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this replication connection supports reciprocal replication.

public bool ReciprocalReplicationEnabled { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if this replication connection supports reciprocal replication; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

ReplicationSchedule

Gets or sets the schedule on which the source server is available for replication.

public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule ReplicationSchedule { get; set; }
Value
ActiveDirectorySchedule

A ActiveDirectorySchedule object that represents the schedule on which the source server is available for replication. If this property is null, then the default schedule is used.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

ReplicationScheduleOwnedByUser

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the replication schedule is owned by the user.

public bool ReplicationScheduleOwnedByUser { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the replication schedule is owned by the user; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

ReplicationSpan

Gets the span of this replication connection.

public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationSpan ReplicationSpan { get; }
Value
ReplicationSpan

One of the ReplicationSpan members that specifies the span of this replication connection.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

SourceServer

Gets the DNS name of the server that is the source of this replication connection.

public string SourceServer { get; }
Value
String

A string that contains the DNS name of the server that is the source of this replication connection.

TransportType

Gets the type of transport that is used by this replication connection.

public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryTransportType TransportType { get; }
Value
ActiveDirectoryTransportType

One of the ActiveDirectoryTransportType members that specifies the type of transport that is used by this replication connection.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

Methods

Delete()

Deletes this replication connection.

public void Delete ();
Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

InvalidOperationException

The ReplicationConnection object has not yet been saved to the underlying directory store.

UnauthorizedAccessException

The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

Dispose()

Releases the unmanaged and managed resources held by the object.

public void Dispose ();

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged and, optionally, the managed resources, held by the object.

protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release the managed resources; otherwise, false.

Finalize()

Overrides the stem.Object.Finalize* method.

~ReplicationConnection ();

FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

Retrieves the ReplicationConnection object that matches the specified target context and name.

public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationConnection FindByName (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string name);
context
DirectoryContext

A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to search for.

name
String

The name of the connection to search for.

Returns
ReplicationConnection

A ReplicationConnection object that represents the connection.

Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

The connection could not be found.

ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ArgumentException

context or name is not valid.

ArgumentNullException

context or name is null.

UnauthorizedAccessException

The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

GetDirectoryEntry()

Retrieves a DirectoryEntry object that represents the replication connection.

public System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry GetDirectoryEntry ();
Returns
DirectoryEntry

A DirectoryEntry object that represents the target of the replication connection.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.

InvalidOperationException

The current object has not been committed to the server. stem.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationConnection.Save* must be called first.

Save()

Commits the replication connection to the server. The replication connection object does not actually exist in Active Directory Domain Services until this method is called.

public void Save ();
Exceptions
ActiveDirectoryOperationException

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

The target server is either busy or unavailable.

ObjectDisposedException

The object has been disposed.

UnauthorizedAccessException

The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

ToString()

Retrieves the name of the replication connection.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that contains the name of the replication connection.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The current object has been disposed.
